data.chText: 预算
data.enText: the money that is available to a person or an organization and a plan of how it will be spent over a period of time

data.chText: 每月 / 年度 / 家庭预算
data.enText: a monthly/an annual/a family budget

data.chText: 教育 / 国防预算
data.enText: the education/defence budget (= the amount of money that can be spent on this)

data.chText: 预计200万元的广告费
data.enText: an advertising budget of $2 million

data.chText: 一部巨额预算的电影
data.enText: a big-budget movie

data.chText: 我们俭省地装修了房子。
data.enText: We decorated the house on a tight budget (= without much money to spend) .

data.chText: 工作按时完成且未超出预算。
data.enText: The work was finished on time and within budget (= did not cost more money than was planned) .

data.chText: 他们超出了预算。
data.enText: They went over budget (= spent too much money) .

data.chText: 预算削减
data.enText: budget cuts
Budget

data.chText: 政府的年度预算
data.enText: an official statement by the government of a country's income from taxes, etc. and how it will be spent

data.chText: 本年度政府预算中的税收削减
data.enText: tax cuts in this year's budget

data.chText: 政府预算赤字
data.enText: a budget deficit (= when the government spends more money than it earns)

data.chText: 谨慎花钱；把…编入预算
data.enText: to be careful about the amount of money you spend; to plan to spend an amount of money for a particular purpose

data.chText: 我们精打细算一点，就能够负担这次旅行。
data.enText: If we budget carefully we'll be able to afford the trip.

data.chText: 我已经把两名新职员名额编入预算。
data.enText: I've budgeted for two new members of staff.

data.chText: 为该工程已编制了一千万法郎的预算。
data.enText: Ten million francs has been budgeted for the project.

data.chText: 该工程已制订一千万法郎的预算。
data.enText: The project has been budgeted at ten million francs.

data.chText: 价格低廉的；花钱少的
data.enText: low in price

data.chText: 便宜的航班 / 旅馆
data.enText: a budget flight/hotel

data.text: cheap ♦ competitive ♦ budget ♦ affordable ♦ reasonable ♦ inexpensive

data.chText: 以上各词均指产品或服务花钱少或低于预期。
data.enText: These words all describe a product or service that costs little money or less money than you expected.
cheap

data.chText: 指花钱少、便宜、收费低廉。
data.enText: costing little money or less money than you expected; charging low prices

data.chText: cheap亦可作贬义，指价低质劣：
data.enText: Cheap can also be used in a disapproving way to suggest that sth is poor quality as well as low in price.

data.chText: 一瓶低价劣质香水
data.enText: a bottle of cheap perfume
competitive

data.chText: 指价格、产品或服务收费方面具有竞争力
data.enText: (of prices, goods or services) as cheap as or cheaper than those offered by other companies; able to offer goods or services at competitive prices
budget

data.chText: （尤用于广告）指仅提供基本服务因而价格低廉
data.enText: [only before noun] (used especially in advertising) cheap because it offers only a basic level of service
affordable

data.chText: 指多数人买得起或负担得来的
data.enText: cheap enough for most people to afford
reasonable

data.chText: 指价格不太高、公道的
data.enText: (of prices) not too expensive
inexpensive

data.chText: 指不昂贵。
data.enText: ( rather formal ) cheap

data.chText: inexpensive常含就价格而言合算之意，有时用以代替cheap，因为cheap可有质量低劣的含义。
data.enText: Inexpensive is often used to mean that sth is good value for its price. It is sometimes used instead of cheap , because cheap can suggest that sth is poor quality.
cheap/competitive/budget/affordable/reasonable prices/fares/rates
cheap/competitive/budget/affordable/inexpensive goods/products/services
to be/become/seem/sound cheap/competitive/affordable/reasonable/inexpensive
quite/relatively/extremely/very cheap/competitive/affordable/reasonable/inexpensive

data.text: save ♦ budget ♦ economize ♦ tighten your belt ♦ scrimp

data.chText: 以上各词均含存钱、攒钱之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to keep money instead of spending it.
save

data.chText: 常指为了买某物而攒钱、储蓄：
data.enText: to keep money instead of spending it, often in order to buy a particular thing

data.chText: 我正攒钱想买辆新车。
data.enText: I'm saving for a new car.
budget

data.chText: 指谨慎花钱、把…编入预算：
data.enText: to be careful about the amount of money you spend; to plan to spend an amount of money for a particular purpose

data.chText: 我们精打细算一点，就能够负担这次旅行。
data.enText: If we budget carefully we'll be able to afford the trip.
economize

data.chText: 指节省、节约、节俭
data.enText: to use less money, time, etc. than you normally use
tighten your belt

data.chText: 指勒紧腰带省吃俭用：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) to spend less money because there is less available

data.chText: 由于物价上涨，我们都只好勒紧裤腰带了。
data.enText: With the price increases, we are all having to tighten our belts.
scrimp

data.chText: 尤指为了攒钱节衣缩食、省吃俭用：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) to spend very little money on the things that you need to live, especially so that you can save it to spend on sth else

data.chText: 他们省吃俭用，为的是攒钱让孩子受到良好的教育。
data.enText: They scrimped and saved to give the children a good education.
to have to save/budget/economize/tighten our belts
to try to/manage to save/budget/economize
to save up/budget for sth
to economize/scrimp on sth

ex.chText: 这本书的出版费用预算很低。
ex.enText: The book was produced on a very small budget.

synonyms.bx: 主要指未来一段时期内的收入和支出计划。

ex.chText: 他用信用卡结账后离开了酒店。
ex.enText: He left the hotel, settling his account by credit card.

synonyms.bx: 指商店、餐馆等开出的单据，表明某人应支付的消费金额。
指用于特殊目的而积攒或筹集起来的资金。

ex.chText: 有人留了一大笔钱给他。
ex.enText: He was left a large sum of money.

synonyms.bx: 最普通用词，指广义上的钱，可以是硬币、纸币、支票等。

ex.chText: 她的帽子看上去很便宜。
他买了辆便宜的山地自行车。
ex.enText: He bought a cheap mountain bike.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，可指物美价廉的，也可指价格便宜但质量低劣的。

ex.chText: 她以低廉的价钱买下了这所房子。
ex.enText: She bought the house at a budget price.

synonyms.bx: 指价格极低的，常用于广告中，含特价优惠之意。

ex.chText: 毫无疑问，这么便宜的商品靠的是极为廉价的劳动力。
ex.enText: Undoubtedly, such cheap goods rely on dirt cheap labour.

synonyms.bx: 常用于口语中，强调非常廉价的。

tr: a summary of intended expenditures along with proposals for how to meet them
example: the president submitted the annual budget to Congress

tr: a sum of money allocated for a particular purpose
example: the laboratory runs on a budget of a million a year

value.def: Your budget is the amount of money that you have available to spend. The budget for something is the amount of money that a person, organization, or country has available to spend on it.

example.ex: She will design a fantastic new kitchen for you — and all within your budget...
example.tran: 她将为你设计一个超级棒的新厨房，而且绝不会超出你的预算。

example.ex: Someone had furnished the place on a tight budget...
example.tran: 有人没花多少钱简单地把这个地方布置了一下。

example.ex: This year's budget for AIDS prevention probably won't be much higher.
example.tran: 今年用于防治艾滋病的预算很可能不会比往年高很多。

value.def: The budget of an organization or country is its financial situation, considered as the difference between the money it receives and the money it spends.

example.ex: The hospital obviously needs to balance the budget each year.
example.tran: 很明显，医院每年都要平衡其收支预算。

example.ex: ...his readiness to raise taxes as part of an effort to cut the budget deficit.
example.tran: 他已准备把增加税收作为削减预算赤字的措施之一

value.def: In Britain, the Budget is the financial plan in which the government states how much money it intends to raise through taxes and how it intends to spend it. The Budget is also the speech in which this plan is announced.

example.ex: The Chancellor could use the Budget to bring in taxation reforms.
example.tran: 财政大臣可以利用政府年度预算演讲的机会提出税收改革事宜。

example.ex: ...other indirect tax changes announced in the Budget.
example.tran: 在政府预算中公布的其他间接税收变动

value.tran: （英国的）政府年度预算案，政府年度预算演讲

value.def: If you budget certain amounts of money for particular things, you decide that you can afford to spend those amounts on those things.

example.ex: The company has budgeted $10 million for advertising...
example.tran: 公司已经做了1,000万美元的广告预算。

example.ex: The movie is only budgeted at $10 million...
example.tran: 该电影的预算只有1,000万美元。

example.ex: We have continued to exercise caution in our budgeting for the current year.
example.tran: 在编制今年的预算时，我们会一如既往地谨慎从事。

value.def: Budget is used in advertising to suggest that something is being sold cheaply.

example.ex: Cheap flights are available from budget travel agent from £240.
example.tran: 收费低廉的旅行社可以提供240英镑起的低价机票。
